intro: Guatteria macrophylla var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-leaved guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are smooth and glossy. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, followed by yellow or orange berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in botanical studies and horticulture.
